page.title: 04Ecology
page.content: 1985 January to July described by one of more than 70 years in the district as very cold, very wet and very windy, Broadly of a west maritime climate with mountain influences. Memorable hot summers with drought conditions 1976 and 1984. In frosty wintery conditions , temperatures in the valleys are 4 degrees lower than on the hill sides. The long distance footpath, called "Offa's Dyke Footpath", crosses the south east corner of the area.Many other paths cross the area. It is good walking country with many fine views across boh the English and the Welsh Countryside. Wild flowers are plentyful in the hedgerows. Many varities of birds nest in area including buzzards.
